intro: Parnassia simplex, commonly known as the white crowfoot, is a flowering plant native to the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its leaves are palmately divided, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. Parnassia simplex is often found in alpine and subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions.
